page.title: 13Local History 2
page.content: {Interview:Mr.and Mrs.Smith (cont'd) When asked about{"Thwaite Hall"}we were told that thwaite was a Norwegian word meaning "clearing in the wood" which made the woods where the Hall is still seen very old.Mr.Smith thought that it was possibly a farm run and worked by monks in the middle ages.It is now being converted into a shooting lodge by Mr.Roughton. {Changes } When asked about changes in the village since they had moved in,they both thought the noise had increased, because more vehicles used the roads in the village,there were more houses and small fields had been made bigger by removing hedges.{Clover Dairies, a thriving dairy giving work to the community,had disappeared and with it the enormous chimney there. {Interview concluded on page 14.
